Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Investigate changing extensionlist/extension mechanism naming to more closely match Office use" (#1697) at dotnet/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
There are two things that may be confusing and/or incorrect about our use of extensionlist/extension mechanism: 

1. When Office team provides CT_ExtensionList and CT_Extension types in xsd definitions, we have been using specialized CT_<feature>ExtensionList/CT_<feature>Extension types to map these. The reason goes back to early days where it was confusing and difficult to just use CT_ExtensionList for all the features due to name collisions. However, it's possible we could have handled this differently. The CT_Extension class makes use of uri attributes to associate each extension for specific features.
This would of course be a breaking change and would require refactoring any code using the extensions.

2. Our use of the uri attributes has not been consistent and some cleanup is likely needed there. This may also involve coordination with our Open Specifications extension documentation as some guids used as uri may not be listed.

Dependabot commands and options

You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot show ignore conditions` will show all of the ignore conditions of the specified dependency - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Change SpreadSheetML namespace to SpreadsheetML" (#1694) at dotnet/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
**Description**

The `DocumentFormat.OpenXml.Office.SpreadSheetML` namespace should be changed to `DocumentFormat.OpenXml.Office.SpreadsheetML` (with lowercase s)

**Information**

- .NET Target: any
- DocumentFormat.OpenXml Version: 2.15.0+

**Expected**

Spreadsheet should be one word.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue ".NET Core 8 taking a lot longer to build and publish" (#1693) at dotnet/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
**Describe the bug**

I have a couple of **.NET Core 6** projects that use `DocumentFormat.OpenXml` version `2.17.1 `. Using **Bitbucket pipeline**, I am building a Docker image using these projects (DLLs), and I have the `dotnet build` and `dotnet publish` commands in the **Dockerfile**. The Dockerfile uses `mcr.microsoft.com/dotnet/sdk:8.0-alpine3.19` to execute the above commands.

Here is the time spent on each task.

```
dotnet build - 34.3s
dotnet publish - 17.4s
```
These projects have been upgraded to **.NET Core 8**. Now it's taking a lot longer to complete the tasks than before.

Here is the time spent on each task after upgrading to **.NET Core 8**.

```
dotnet build - 342.5s
dotnet publish - 1399.1s
```

Previously, it took only **1-2 minutes** to complete. After upgrading to **.NET Core 8**, it's taking around **30 minutes** to complete.

What could be the issue? Has anyone else been experiencing the same thing?
